title: Basic math trivia game with smartphone
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to create a basic math trivia game with a smartphone and a laptop.
Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Devices.png) on the sidebar
Press ![add output](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/AddDevice.png) button

Select **SmartphoneOrientation** to access to the data of the accelerometer of your smartphone

![SmartphoneOrientation](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/SmartphoneOrientation-Item.png)

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)
Press **Confirm** when asked.

Press again on 'Devices', 'Add device to system' and select **InteractiveWriteDraw** to create in your device an interactive whiteboard

![InteractiveWriteDraw device](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/InteractiveWriteDraw-Item.png)
Click on _Open in this device_ to open the InteractiveWriteDraw locally
Press ![variables](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/Variables.png) on the sidebar

Press ![create-variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/create-variable.png) and create three variables, 'number1', 'number2', 'result'; each of the first two variables will store a number, and the variable 'result' will store the result of the sum of the two numbers
Press again ![variables](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/Variables.png) on the sidebar
Move ![create-variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/set-variable.png) of each variable to the workspace

Use the ![create-variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/random-integer-component.png) to set the number variables as in the figure below

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/set-numbers.png)

Use the ![create-variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/basic-operations-component.png)
, the ![set-variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/set-variable.png) and the ![variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/variable.png) to set the result variable as in the figure below

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/set-result.png)

Move the **write** component into the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/write-text.png) you can set the position of the text with coordinates, the size of the text, and the colour of the text

Use the previous component,![create-variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/create-text-with.png)
and ![set-variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Text/text-component.png) to write a math trivia, in this case a sum trivia, as in the figure below

![text](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/text.png)

Now we need to write the alternatives, you can choose which alternative is the correct one, use the variable 'result' and a random number for the alternatives ![create-variable](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/alternatives.png)
Press ![timing](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Timing/Timing.png) on the sidebar
Press ![delay](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Timing/delay-component.png) this is to wait for the player's answer
Press ![delay](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/clear.png) to clear the whiteboard and show the user whether the selected answer was the correct one
Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar

Move the **if** component into the workspace and add an 'else' as the image below

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/if-else.png) this is for evaluate the orientation of the smartphone with the accelerometer sensor

Move the **comparison, number and smartphoneorientation** components into the workspace, put and configurate the components as the image below

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/comparison.png)
this is for a condition to know if the smartphone is face up or face down, remember that each one of this positions represents an alternative

Conect the before blocks to the if component as the image below

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/component.png)
the program is evaluating that the smartphopne is face up, that is the position of the correct answer

Move the **write** component into the workspace and put it below the if condition, this means that if the condition of the before step is met, the program will execute this block. Write a felicitation message on the board because in this part the player got the answer right. View the image below.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/correct-answer.png)

Move the **write** component into the workspace and put it in the else execute section, this means that the if condition of the 'if' was not met, the program will execute this block. Write a sad message on the board because in this part the player got the answer wrong. View the image below.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/basic-math-game/bad-answer.png)
